A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: As the second movie in a trilogy\, it just does not work.  Putting aside the plot holes\, inappropriate humor\, and illogical developments\, there is a bigger issue.  How does Mr. Abrams or Disney or whoever plan a trilogy and then let a separate writer/director drive the train anywhere he wants without a plan as to where the trip will end or what the trip is?
